definition: Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]

sentences.english: When Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara was practicing the profound Prajna Paramita, he illuminated the Five Skandhas and saw that they are all empty.
sentences.chinese: 觀自在菩薩行甚深般若波羅蜜多時，照見五蘊皆空。

sentences.english: With each passing day, you will possess the merits of the six paramitas.
sentences.chinese: 是人日日得具六波羅蜜圓滿功德。

sentences.english: So the Six Paramitas are tools that allow us to cross (this sea of afflictions).
sentences.chinese: 所以用六波羅蜜這個工具，讓我們度過。

sentences.english: Huh. I have to say Tupelo Honey by Van Morrison.
sentences.chinese: 我會認爲是範莫里森的“土波羅蜜”。

sentences.english: Person is kinds of Polo honey with pleasure, It is wonderful to hit all the treasure.
sentences.chinese: 者樣波羅蜜，便是妙中寶。

sentences.english: As the mind is extensive, so the merit is boundless. Such is named the paramita of giving.
sentences.chinese: 以廣大心皆得無盡無量功德，是即名爲檀波羅蜜。

sentences.english: Prajna Paramita is magic medicine that cures all kinds of puzzling and incurable diseases!
sentences.chinese: 般若波羅蜜多，是良藥，能醫治一切的疑難雜症。

sentences.english: Was coursing in the deep Prajna Paramita.
This sutra should be called 'The Diamond prajna -paramita' under which name you should receive and hold it.
sentences.chinese: 是經名爲《金剛般若波羅蜜》，以是名字，汝當奉持。

sentences.english: Eliminates sadness and sufferings in Six Paths, increases Six Paramita gradually.
sentences.chinese: 解脫六道之苦和六波羅蜜漸次增長。

sentences.english: Prajna Paramita is a sword that can cut out unnecessary tangling and involving!
sentences.chinese: 般若波羅蜜多，是明燈，能指引迷航的水手。

definition: so I have heard (idiom)/the beginning clause of Buddha's quotations as recorded by his disciple, Ananda (Buddhism)
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
